Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: Yes first time running on native

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: I suspect I need to change my bitnexus.conf file but it is not clear how to properly set the config file based on what I have seen in all of the online instructions and forums. Many people have different settings but say it is working for them

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: Maybe difference between Windows and Linux setup

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Ok I have forwarded your message to one of our devs to confirm if there is something missing in the file , we will get back to you shortly

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: Probably RPC settings

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: @Hermes ok thanks

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: What I don't understand is, how can BarterDEX connect to my local wallet if it doesn't know what the RPC username and password are? There is nowhere in BarterDEX to put these settings?

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: Is there a command I can use in debug?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: One of our devs thinks that the issue can be in the bitnexus.conf file path

Author: cipi#4502
Content: yes, because BitNexus wallet uses an unusual path for the config file, the following setting is needed in coins-file ```"confpath":"USERHOME/.bitcoinnodecore/bitnexus.conf"``` and i suspect this does not work properly under Windows: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/BarterDEX/issues/128

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Please if you can @./cryptkeeper  try writing into this link to report the issue üëÜ

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content:
Yes the confpath for Linux is userhome/.bitcoinnodecore/bitnexus.conf

For windows: C:\Users\%userprofile%\AppData\Roaming\BitcoinNodeCore\bitnexus.conf

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: I will report the issue on github as suggested

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: I posted a comment about the issue in issue# 128

Author: vinniepinnie123#6489
Content: Dear KMD support, i would like to report a two serious bugs here on the Agama wallet

Content: I just installed the Agama software for windows and have received already 3 different KMD adresses in the same wallet

Author: vinniepinnie123#6489
Content: first, i opened the Lite mode and send a test transaction from exchange to my new address

Content: when i opened and closed there was suddenly a different adress

Author: vinniepinnie123#6489
Content: after that i manually encrypted my seed and again had another adress

Author: miles#6381
Content: Hi - trying to get Etomic to start in Bartdex - getting a CoinStatus message saying "could not get Etomic from faucet" First i was trying in Electrum mode and then added Etomic to agama in native and tried - same message - any ideas? thnks

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: @vinniepinnie123 Operator error is not a bug. If you got a different address, then you used a different passphrase. That difference could be as simple as an added space or character.

Author: vinniepinnie123#6489
Content: i can prove the bug in print screens

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
`no, I used 100% the same passphrase`
_ComputerGenie is too sleepy to explain why that is impossible and goes to get coffee and his morning bath_
